title: Thank You Riot Opeli and the Narrative Team
body:
Repost from GD to increase visability:

Thank you and the other Reds for talking to us at all. Many of us may disagree with what you're saying and/or how you're saying them but I think we can all be glad that they're coming out and saying something. The wall of silence Lore has had for so long was terrible. I hope we can come together and have a constructive, civil discussion about our grievances/where things are going. Who knows, we might even like where it goes. =D

Oh wait, this is the internet. Civil? lol nope :P

So yeah, keep tanking the forum hate, please. Here, have some Miracle Of Sound to keep those chins up. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z-BS5UhpuFU

replies.body:
As one of the "haters," let me make something clear:  What Opeli has done (by herself mind you) was a **start.**  The entire narrative team has a long way to go, though.

The Lore team created the situation that exists there with two years of ignoring fans in the subforum.  It's not just "the internet."

Maybe, when they prove that they're serious about communication, about having a back and forth dialogue instead of an occasional lecture, and that they're actually producing lore that is better than what we've been getting, we can have that civil discussion.

But, frankly, they have to do the work.

Hate to break it to you, but constantly tearing at them and insulting them is not a great impetus to "do the work". I also believe that they need to put the product where their mouth is and show that this is the correct decision and direction. That being said, the attitude of "I'm going to treat them like shit until they give me everything I want then I'll treat them like a human being" is disgusting and immature.

If you think I'm treating the lore team "like shit," you haven't been paying attention to the forums since Thursday.

Yes, I'm being very crude about it, but I'm done giving this company my blind faith.  Two people from the lore team (Runaan and Opeli) have been talking to people since the dev blog came out.  Two people, out of how many on the lore team?  Really pathetic, imogdo.

In my eyes, it's a nice start, but they still have a long ways to go before they should be congratulated.  They need to keep communication with their fans, ideally until we're sick of it.  they need to show that their new stories are better than what we've had before, and they need to do it without having to wait years between mega events.

I'm not going to be nice about it, but if holding them to the same standards they're trying to reach is I'm treating them "like shit," so be it.

I was mentioning you specifically, but yea, I'd say you've been a prick. How are all of you so blind that you don't understand the concept of all the time they spend sifting through the forums (where you all insult and berate them) is time they **aren't spending on the damn lore you want.**

And for the record, neither you nor anyone else gets to speak for the community. You are a person, and until you end up as an elected official, you don't have the right to speak for me or anyone else.

> I was mentioning you specifically, but yea, I'd say you've been a prick. How are all of you so blind that you don't understand the concept of all the time they spend sifting through the forums (where you all insult and berate them) is time they **aren't spending on the damn lore you want.**

You act as if it hasn't been written yet, or at least conceived.  You seem to believe that all they do is get a direction from someone and go "Right, who do we want to put in Shurima?"  If that's how you think a corporate structure works, you're sadly mistaken.

Never said "constant communication," but a handful of forum posts after years of silence isn't worth giving them the keys to the kingdom.  Communication needs to be consistent and it needs to be two-way, not just lecturing through Dev Blogs.

> 
> And for the record, neither you nor anyone else gets to speak for the community. You are a person, and until you end up as an elected official, you don't have the right to speak for me or anyone else.

Wow, projecting much?  What the actual f***?

For the record:
I speak as someone who has been down this road with Riot before with other departments and projects.
I speak as someone who was given the silent treatment for years by Riot's Lore team.
I speak as someone who, despite being treated like something worse than garbage, still wants the company to succeed.  However, I will not give them the blind faith they constantly ask for and consistently fail to deliver on.
I speak for myself.  No one else.

If other people agree with what I've said, that's fine.  If every post I make gets downvoted to oblivion, just as well.

You have a voice.  You have a mind.  You have fingers, a computer, a keyboard and internet access.  You have the ability to communicate, so you can speak up for your own god damned self.

Or not.  Doesn't mean a damn thing to me.  Until I'm proven wrong by Narrative, (and I look forward to the day I am), this is how it is.

You act as if lore isn't something that consistently grows and (ideally) should be constantly being worked on and progressed. How is that anywhere close to what I said? And that Dev Blog didn't seem anywhere close to lecturing to me, actually, nothing that Riot says sounds like lectures. Whoever gave you lectures was bad at it or something, but that sounded like an open attempt to explain what they were doing, why they were doing it, and where they were hoping to take it. Why do you think that Riot should be updating you (or the community) about every single update? That's ridiculous. If only there was a quote about that kind of horrible idea....

>If that's how you think a corporate structure works, you're sadly mistaken.

Damn, thanks for that? They should communicate more though, you're right about that. But I think its being foolish to not look at all the shit that any Riot employee gets anytime they show up on the forums and not understand why they might not want to or might be hesitant to do so. Quite frankly, I just fundamentally believe that the majority of what the League community says isn't worth the time it took them to type it. I don't think there is always value in feedback, at least not in every piece of feedback. Some decisions should be solely Riot's. I don't know if we agree on that or not, but I think both of don't think the other person has any interest in agreeing either way (at least that's the vibe I'm getting from you, could be wrong)

I think you're significantly less important than you think you are. **You** got the silent treatment? You aren't owed a damn thing from Riot. They don't have to tell you shit. Neither you nor anyone else in this community is entitled to anything that you are asking for. "Being treated worse than garbage"? Let me grab my tiny violin real quick. Grow up. It isn't about you. You aren't being mistreated and oppressed by the terrible Riot employees so quit acting like you're some victim.

A couple of things.

First, from the beginning of the thread, definitely good job to Opeli for all the efforts on the forums.

Secondly, while we could go round and round about who deserves what and who's entitled to what, the main point is that League of Legends has *always* been about the community. The game, the company, everything wouldn't be around if it weren't for passionate players. So regardless of whether I agree with TerraRising or not, they're certainly welcome to express frustration if that's what they feel. In fact, the passion around the lore is **great** to see.

The best way to win TerraRising's and every other players trust is to work hard, collaborate with the community and deliver awesome content. With the new dev blog, we're taking an admittedly overdue first step. And I don't think anyone at Riot believes that's enough. So we'll take the, well, probably deserved heat on the silence, and keep moving forward.

Hey Slackeroo! I really don't mean to be rude and I'm sorry if this may come off that way, but I don't see the "collaboration" of which you speak. It certainly seems to us that you guys had an idea, and that you're going to execute it without our input; many of us have been asking for compromise (not a complete shift in direction - I think we can agree that that would be too much at this point), but these requests have been met with statements of dismissal rather than actual consideration.
League of Lorekillers

> Secondly, while we could go round and round about who deserves what and who's entitled to what, the main point is that League of Legends has *always* been about the community. 
> 

Right, we're supposed to believe this? The lore team hasn't delivered ANYTHING for 3 years, and when they finally come out and say something, it's not: here's a bunch of awesome new lore we've been working on for forever -- it's: screw all you Lore fans, we're trashing all of it and starting over because we're too lazy to deal with the story that you care about. 

People who don't care about lore, aren't going to care after the retcons either. The people who do care, you have just lost as paying customers, myself included. And somehow you're still deluding yourselves thinking you know what we want...

> Secondly, while we could go round and round about who deserves what and who's entitled to what, the main point is that League of Legends has *always* been about the community. The game, the company, everything wouldn't be around if it weren't for passionate players.

That's great to hear.

Just one small problem.  You have made this grand statement that you're destroying everything that we, the passionate players, love.  We don't like that, so we collectively provide you with volumes of extremely negative feedback regarding your decision.  At what point do you stop, look at all of this negative feedback, and think to yourselves, "Gee, maybe we made a mistake here.  We might need to actually re-examine this decision...", instead of, politely of course, telling us where to shove it?

>In fact, the passion around the lore is **great** to see.

...so you mean to tell me that you didn't see this when you dropped the League Judgements way back in 2011 with Graves?  When we begged you guys to keep doing them?

Or a year after that, when you discontinued the JoJ, and really didn't explain why?  How we begged and pleaded for at least some reasoning on the decision, and never got any?

Honestly, I thought Riot had learned after Trundle.  Openly acknowledging that his retconning was terribly mishandled was a huge admission.  But looking at what's going on now, you guys clearly haven't learned anything at all.

> The best way to win TerraRising's and every other players trust is to work hard, ***collaborate with the community*** and deliver awesome content.

Isn't this part of the issue though? Where you guys are currently running into problems is that you seem unwilling to compromise or work with the community on this great sundering you are creating to start the lore anew.

You say you ought to collaborate, but as we have been told since the Dev Blog, this lore is going to change, and we need to just trust you.

But that is the ISSUE time and time again, Riot lost our trust with Lore. Sure, coming here and talking to us after 3 years is a good step in the right direction, but the collaboration is really where you are going to build trust. Nothing you can do going forward will be met with anything but venom without Riot collaborating with the community to build up the trust they need to say "trust us".

Skarner's lore retcon, the whole world's lore retcon, the fact that small "quips" about champions are supposed to encourage players to go to the website to find out more about a champion, all of these are things the community either disagrees with, or are very vocal about.

Doesn't that seem like a good place to build trust, give and take? Honestly, this is a PERFECT spot to give the community a nod of "We are back, actually listening, and we are willing to work with you to deliver what YOU want as a community."

League doesn't exist without its community, and you propose to be community-oriented. Your post even reiterates that. So why not start by PROVING you are community-oriented?

Thus far, all we've gotten is "trust us, you don't know the whole picture."

Unfortunately we cannot trust you until you give us reason to do so, and words are not enough to do that after 3 years.

It´s a shame these boards don´t allow me to upvote comments for some unknown reason...but this just deserves a ton of upvotes. 

It´s just allways the same...everytime there are complaints it´s "you guys are awesome, we certainly fcare a lot about you, Riot is all about the community" - but there´s just no action in this direction at all from Riots side. The only thing that ever changed due to community-complaints ahd been the Lee Sin rework...despite half the community actually wanted to see it happen.
Here almost noone wants to see gameplay and story seperated, killing all immersion, all reason. 
You say you want to tell stories around Champions/Characters - ok. The problem however is....all this guys live in a world without a soul if you take the IoW out of it. And I certainly won´t care what happens in such a world. no matter to whom. And I certainly will stop spending money on this game...this game i once joined because it had a great lore supporting the gameplay - unlike Dota or any other Moba.

There's a problem Riot already knows about with non-na forumgoers being unable to vote. I can still vote on threads in the board (thread-overview) screen though, so the most important votes are still possible.

Jayce's lore got adjusted to portray Viktor a bit less as a true villain and more as an understandable villain (Viktor is a great villain). Only lore example I can think of where feedback was acted upon though. 

Personal speculation coming right up:
It will be a generic world focused on the champions within them. There will be conflicts between generic factions and while nobody really has a reason to care about the conflicts inherently, the champions interacting with the conflicts will be the focus and the reason to care. While I don't think this is the best story one can tell about Runeterra, with institute or even without, it does make telling stories about champions easier since you don't really have to tell stories about the world anymore, you tell them only to support the champions.

Now if they'd to this but also retcon our champions to be entirely different characters, they should've just started a new lore with new characters. But if they want to keep their characters identities intact during the retconning to this new world, I'm fine with it (Runaan posted on na forums they want to do this). Only thing is they already messed up with Trundle (I created a [thread](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/wTyGbUfK-the-characters-migration-to-the-new-lore) about this).

I do want to thank the Rioters still daring to post on forums, I'd upvote you all if I could for the effort alone. We are a bit hostile, but that's only because we care about and are invested in the lore and after two years of silence we see you guys, without knowing who really, planning to do scary stuff with it. I also had quite a lack of proof of that you guys are good enough to pull this retcon off, the Freljord actually proves the opposite to me. So personally I'm quite cynical until I get an answer about that too (ah irony).

Let me clarify a few things:

The dev blog was a first step.  The lore team has a long way to go before I'm ready to trust you guys, and that includes accomplishing your lofty goals of writing better stories and communicating with your fans on a regular basis.

I've been down this road before.  It wasn't worth the journey then, so please understand why I'm hesitant about taking another trip that starting the same way.

Don't let me, and the rest of your fans who feel how I do, down, Riot.

> A couple of things.
> 
> First, from the beginning of the thread, definitely good job to Opeli for all the efforts on the forums.
> 
> Secondly, while we could go round and round about who deserves what and who's entitled to what, the main point is that League of Legends has *always* been about the community. The game, the company, everything wouldn't be around if it weren't for passionate players. So regardless of whether I agree with TerraRising or not, they're certainly welcome to express frustration if that's what they feel. In fact, the passion around the lore is **great** to see.
> 
> The best way to win TerraRising's and every other players trust is to work hard, collaborate with the community and deliver awesome content. With the new dev blog, we're taking an admittedly overdue first step. And I don't think anyone at Riot believes that's enough. So we'll take the, well, probably deserved heat on the silence, and keep moving forward.

League of Legends ( can't really be a league of legends anymore now that you killed the league completely ) was about the community years ago.  The frustration has been mounting for many years.  Not just about lore but about every single thing that Riot refuses to do.  I know it's not your department but servers?  Lag?  Ping?  Replays?  Purple side camera?  A multitude of champion reworks and VU's?  Everything we have been told is coming has been false.  It's past the point of frustration.  You would have seen the passion about lore if you guys had actually given a damn and talked to the community.  One red post on the lore forums every 6 damn months is garbage.

You have had years to work hard, collaborate with the community, and deliver awesome content.  The new dev blog was a big middle finger to everybody saying we don't give a hell what you think and we are going to destroy the foundation of the entire game.  

I hear Riot employees talk about how you don't believe it is enough what you do for the game.  Well, here's a clue.  You haven't really done anything but esports for years.  Seriously, the problems can be traced back to when esports started getting popular.   The entire company completely lost sight of the entire community and you focus on a few players.  You give them almost EVERYTHING the community has been asking for.  It's a big slap in the face to everybody.  

Probably deserved heat?  Are you serious?  Even now after all this outrage and backlash you guys still can't say you did something wrong.  Well hot damn you guys must be infallible then.  In all seriousness the community hasn't seen much or heard much of anything from anybody in years.  It's absolutely ridiculous that you think this is ok. 

Remember, actions speak louder than words.  Riot's actions have shown exactly the opposite of your words.

> Secondly, while we could go round and round about who deserves what and who's entitled to what, the main point is that League of Legends has *always* been about the community. 

Really... you sure about that...

Last I check you guys just kicked us out of the game's world without asking or talking to us for TWO GOD DAMN YEARS. 

You so fucking sure it is all about the community.

You sure it isn't not that you want to make books, comics, and movies. and that the Summoners might have taken just a hint of skill to write around, so you divorced us from the lore completely so you could "go in a new direction."

Videogames are an interactive medium. It is the one type of fiction that had THAT as its key. The lore is there make the player feel connected to the story... but you just finish removing us from it completely.

In short... I play League of Legends... Not Heros of Runeterra.

> A couple of things.
> 
> First, from the beginning of the thread, definitely good job to Opeli for all the efforts on the forums.
>

Didn't she just piss a bunch of players off with her dismissive comments?

These are nice words. They don't seem to be supported by the Lore teams actions at the moment though. Like not even a little bit. You guys are outright ignoring us and saying we arent doing an event to get rid of the League because we aren't. We are technically at negative lore now. We had more lore before this bloody retcon. Why are you stripping away Four years of foundation. I have made at least two threads with heavy expounding of why this direction is bad. Here is one of them. I will go find the other later. http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=49851258&posted=1#post49851258

There is a difference between being the game being about the community (which is obvious...the game is a product?) and the community behaving like spoiled children about every single thing that doesn't go there way. Technically speaking, a lot more players are in Bronze or Unranked and disagree with balance being based around Challenger/Competitive. Does that mean that you guys should balance around Bronze/Unranked now because it appeases the most people? I'd say the obvious answer is no. At some point hard decisions have to be made and I'd say the lore situation is one of them. All of you at Riot work incredibly hard on League, retconning the story behind it (even though it seems its been decided it will be better in the long run) has to make you sad and at least miss it a bit. I doubt the decision was a consensus though, so how many people at Riot are flaming and berating those that favor the decision? None right? Because that isn't mature and it isn't constructive.

I don't take issue with constructive criticism, you guys and most companies need it. I don't agree that things outside of constructive criticism is acceptable "heat". Even if you guys screwed up on communication, it isn't appropriate to say you should be fired or question your integrity as an employee or a company (which seems to be popular for some reason?). It is appropriate to say you guys dropped the ball (you did), that you need to communicate more frequently with more meaningful content in that communication (you do), and that with a change this large its going to take some evidence to prove Riot's decision was right (you...uh..something).

Yeah but you see.. its what they're paid for.
To write lore.
So...if they "don't want to do the work"...etcetc then they probably aren't right for the job.
I'm pretty sure everyone who signs up for lore team/is put on lore team knows what that means and how their decisions mean a lot to the community.
Measure twice, cut once, riot.

They are paid to write lore. Accurate. They **are not** paid to write lore for you or anyone else in the community. They are employed by Riot Games to write lore for Riot's game in whatever manner that Riot pleases. They believe that it is necessary to retconn and adjust the lore in order to move forward in writing the lore. That falls under creative license, i.e. the author/authors are at the liberty to construct their work in the manner that they deem fit.

I didn't say they didn't want to work. I said that the berating and degrading and petty, childish behavior of this community was not a great impetus to do the work. People work better when motivated. Currently they are motivated because its their job, they love the lore, and various other personal reasons. If the community was more mature and people had manners, then they might be able to add a very supportive and excited community to those motivations. As it stands however any motivation they are getting from the community is "I want these guys that I'm trying to make happy to quit telling me to kill myself and that I should be fired."

>People work better when motivated. Currently they are motivated because its their job, they love the lore, and various other personal reasons. If the community was more mature and people had manners, then they might be able to add a very supportive and excited community to those motivations.

Well, mature people sometimes like to question sth. they get told. A lot of people do/did  this regarding to the lore-blog, almost all of them in a constructive/respectfull manner. None got the slightest response. 
In fact...mature people even question their own work, especially if they get a lot of resistence from the very people they want to seel their product to (the lore to the people caring about the lore in this case). It´s not really the community that is attacking anyone at riot directly, it´s just the overall lack of a reaction from Riot that leads to a situation of extreme disappointment here. 
And in such a situation the least thing they can expect is getting good will from the people they are sort of mocking with their announcement and the "communication" afterwards.

Yet again, there have been responses on the Dev Blog and in separate threads, if you don't see these, I can't help you, but that doesn't mean they don't exist. You think its realistic that Riot reply to every single thread that people make about the lore changes? You've lost your mind. Even if they only limit it to constructive and polite threads, which there have been some off I'll admit, that would still be an extreme amount. Its like you people don't understand there is a finite amount of time in the day or that people have to shift priorities. Respond to every single thread telling people that you are working on the lore or work on the lore? Maybe if everyone would stop jumping down people's throat and act like decent human beings to other **people** then they would be more willing to talk and discuss. As it is now, every time anyone from Riot tries to discuss things, they get berated and insulted. That isn't healthy for people in general, let alone for a working environment.

There wouldn't be negative feedback if it was done right the first time without the community being ignored.

Don't like the truth?

Are you new to the internet or something? Riot could do everything perfectly and people would still moan and bitch. How many people have cried about things being wrong and then now no one complains about them? Ever think that maybe its because Riot knows what they are doing and the community doesn't? Real shocker I know, it baffles the mind to think that these paid professionals might actually know something about their game that the people who aren't paid to design and maintain it don't.

nobody is insulting them? but a lot of people are hugly disappointed in what they offer...

there´s a huge difference between criticism and insulting someone.  Just giving them even more time after 2years of silence to "show this is the correct decuision" won´t do. They should have been prepared to come up with a lot more than that if they really want to tear appart the work of their predecessors and the sole reasoning behind the gameplay.

>nobody is insulting them?

That is just a straight up lie.

I would have prefered another 10years of silence to this reveal of a horrible massaker of the current lore...
and not communicating ever since, not reacting to a ton of good and constructive ideas on how to keep the lore as it is with minor fixes just is even worse than being silent forever.

"Yeah i prefer the Lore dead that in a kind of growth"
srsly?

That's the thing.  The Lore isn't growing.  It's being replaced.

It's like gardening.  You relanscaped your yard a few months ago, and there's this 1 plant that is growing just fine, you just don't like how the foliage is sitting.  Rather than pruning it and working with the branches to get the shape you want on a perfectly healthy plant, you rip it out and put in another plant in it's place.

Soo you are basically saying that they are doing well, since theyr plant ( lore is only a part of the game ) is not growing well and that they need to eradicate it, indipendently the attachment of people to that plant?

EDIT: reread the comment, not sure i understood well.

There have been dozens of well thought out, constructive threads about lote on these boards  all week and this is the one that gets a red post, typical. If you guys are really gonna still claim to be "community focused" how about you at least pay lip service to peoples concerns instead of just popping in to pat yourselves on the back?
